channel.title: How would I go about this: Ranged on Object [508]
channel.description:
Hi..
Subject really covers it... I know what I have to do though, just not sure how to do it. I believe I need to somehow make it so that when the object is clicked, a gfx/projectile/animation will happen as if the player character shoots it with his/her bow and then receive ranged experience for that action.
I looked around in ObjectOption1 and I know how to make the case for the object id... Just not how exactly to make the stuff happen.
I hope any of that makes any straightforward sense. If someone can offer help, great!

item.title: How would I go about this: Ranged on Object [508]
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

createProjectile() method in *.io.Frames might work…? FOr creating the projectile of the arrow… And then I just need to make the PC turn to face the actual target (which i crashed my client attempting to do lol).

But yeah, I got everything else pretty much set up.

Read full topic

item.title: How would I go about this: Ranged on Object [508]
item.dc:creator: @ghostly150 ghostly150
item.description:
@ghostly150 wrote:

There’s two combat files I’m seeing in this base: PlayerNPCCombat and just PlayerCombat. I think what I need then is the PlayerNPCCombat one, which I’ve already been poking around in to see if I can get some ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: How would I go about this: Ranged on Object [508]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Easiest way I see this being done is to act as if the object was a monster (runescape does this at times) and make it only work with range attacks. You’d have to see how range is handled on the server.

Read full topic
